name: AstroLunch
tagline: Summarizes the topics we have discussed in the Astronomy Seminar (AKA AstroLunch@Uniandes)
body:
## Welcome
In this webpage we will keep track of the topics discussed (or to be discussed) during AstroLunch @Uniandes. We will meet up in Room Ip-101 every Friday at 1PM. During the first 15 minutes we will discuss the latest in the journals (Nature or Science) or any other interesting paper on the arXiv. In the next 40 minutes we will try to have 2 talks. One by somebody external to Uniandes and the second one by local students or faculty. The talks will be done on the blackboard, if you really need it you can use a couple of slides.

Ah! And this is Astro **Lunch**. Remember to bring your own lunch and some food to share.

##Programme (2013-II)

### Week 1 (August 2)

* Nicolas Garavito. A summer internship at [CIDA](http://www.cida.gob.ve/cida_home/) in Merida, Venezuela.
* Jaime E. Forero-Romero. A visit to [KIAS](http://www.kias.re.kr/sub03/sub03_02_08_01.jsp) in Seoul, South Korea. 
* Maria Camila Remolina. Red de Estudiantes Colombianos de Astronomia [RECA](https://sites.google.com/site/recastronomia/)

### Week 2 (August 9)

* [Astrobites](http://astrobites.com/)
* [Astroplots](http://astrobites.tumblr.com/)
* [Astronomy Picture of the Day] (http://apod.nasa.gov/apod/astropix.html)
* [Interactive astronomy software produced by graduate students](http://ay201b.wordpress.com/topical-modules/2013-topical-modules/)
* Juan Camilo Buitrago (Uniandes). Basic Topics on Solar Physics.

### Week 3 (August 16)

* Juan Pablo Arango
* Sebastián Rosales. Legislación ultra-terrestre. [link to pdf](https://github.com/forero/AstroSeminarUniandes/blob/master/pdf/20130816_SebastianRosales.pdf)
* Germán Chaparro. Ciencia en el patio de juegos. Ciencia interactiva. [link to pdf](https://github.com/forero/AstroSeminarUniandes/blob/master/pdf/20130816_GermanChaparro.pdf).

### Week 4 (August 23)

* Jaime E. Forero-Romero. A brief history of massive spectroscopy in three images: [1](https://raw.github.com/forero/AstroSeminarUniandes/master/IMG/sdssplate.jpg) [2](https://raw.github.com/forero/AstroSeminarUniandes/master/IMG/plugplate.jpg) [3](https://raw.github.com/forero/AstroSeminarUniandes/master/IMG/boss_1stlight_fiber-cartridge.jpg)
* María Fernanda Gómez. Black hole growth. [link to pdf](https://github.com/forero/AstroSeminarUniandes/blob/master/pdf/20130823_MariaFernandaGomez.pdf)
* Diego Umaña. Recent CMB power spectrum polarization measurements. [link to pdf](https://github.com/forero/AstroSeminarUniandes/blob/master/pdf/20130823_DiegoUmana.pdf)

### Week 5 (August 30)

* Angélica Suárez. De estallido de formación estelar a fracaso de formación estelar. [link to pdf](https://github.com/forero/AstroSeminarUniandes/blob/master/pdf/20130830_AngelicaSuarez.pdf)
* Giovanni Pinzón. Astronomical Expedition around Colombia. [link to pdf](https://github.com/forero/AstroSeminarUniandes/blob/master/pdf/20130830_GiovanniPinzon.pdf)

### Week 6 (September 6)

* Daniel Lozano
* Nicolás Romero

### Week 7 (September 13)

* **Deadline First Report**
* Sandra Hernández. [Generalities about astronomical occultations](http://prezi.com/zj2wtleacsuk/sandra-y-hernandez/?utm_campaign=share&utm_medium=copy)


### Week 8 (September 20)

* Ramiro Medina. Zero Age Main Sequence Stars.
* Jaime E. Forero-Romero. [A strong magnetic field around the Milky Way's black hole](http://arxiv.org/abs/1308.3147)

### Week 9 (October 4)

* Juan Camilo Montoya
* Santiago Vega

### Week 10 (October 11)

* Sebastián Velasco
* Jose Augusto Villegas

### Week 11 (October 18)

* Luz Andrea Marino
* Nicolás Marchena

### Week 12 (October 25)

* Daniel Fajardo

### Week 13 (November 1)

### Week 14 (November 8)

### Week 15 (November 15)

### Week 16 (November 22)
* **Deadline Last Report**

##Grading

If you are getting credits from this seminar, you have to be graded. We will grade attendance (20%), class participation -give at least one talk- (20%) and a project (30% first report + 30% final report). The project can be anything from studying an interesting paper to dealing with a research project that might end up being the subject for your undergrad thesis.

##Contact
Jaime E. Forero-Romero (http://wwwprof.uniandes.edu.co/~je.forero/ email: je.forero) will lead the seminar during 2013-II. Contact him if you want to give a talk or know more about AstroLunch.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
